comment: The infimum of a set of reals ` A ` is the negative of the supremum of the negatives of its elements. The antecedent ensures that ` A ` is nonempty and has a lower bound. (Contributed by NM, 14-Jun-2005.) (Revised by AV, 4-Sep-2020.)
